column_.text_: Estalucia, the Island of the Astrals

This world of floating islands stretches over many
skydoms, each of which are separated by a
turbulent zone known as the Grim Basin.

This world of floating islands stretches over many skydoms, each of which are
separated by a turbulent zone known as the Grim Basin. The Sky Realm was
ruled long ago by powerful beings called Astrals, until the skydwellers
overthrew and exiled them in an insurrection now known as the War.

The denizens of the sky. They are broadly divided
into four "peoples," each with distinct physical
characteristics: Humans, Draphs, Erunes, and
Harvins.

The denizens of the sky. They are broadly divided into four "peoples," each 
with distinct physical characteristics: Humans, Draphs, Erunes, and Harvins.
After overthrowing the Astrals in the great War, skydwellers adapted the
technology of their former oppressors to build their own complex civilizations.

Astrals wield terrible power, defying even the
laws of nature. They once subjugated the Sky
Realm, but in a miraculous reversal of fortune,
lost to skydwellers in the great War and were
buried deep in the sands of history.

Though the origins of Astrals are yet a mystery, one thing is certain: they
wield terrible power, defying even the laws of nature. They once subjugated
the Sky Realm, forever changing the course of its history, but in a miraculous
reversal of fortune were defeated by skydwellers in an insurrection known as
the War. Though the physical presence of Astrals has all but faded into myth,
their influence remains in the form of unique technology, some of which is still
utilized in modern airships.

The Astral Loki appears as a teenage boy who wanders with the primal beast
Fenrir in tow. He is given to whimsy and keeps his true intentions a mystery.
Despite claiming to be a neutral observer, Loki has been discovered to instigate
trouble amongst skydwellers, and often crosses paths with 
and crew.

The Astral Mikaboshi first appears to the crew as a cheery young amnesiac.
However, it is eventually revealed that, in the days of the War, she was a
tyrant who ruled over Nalhegrande and hungered for the subjugation of the
skies—a revelation which turns her cold and brutal.

The War refers to a rebellion that took place
hundreds of years ago, in which skydwellers
overthrew and exiled their Astral oppressors.

The War refers to a rebellion that took place hundreds of years ago, in which
skydwellers overthrew and exiled their Astral oppressors. Though memory of the
War has largely been eroded by time, it was this momentous event that laid the
foundations for the Sky Realm that exists today.

This turbulent zone is filled with pestilent
vapors. It forms the boundary between skydoms.

This turbulent zone is filled with pestilent vapors, powerful monsters, and
ship-shattering gales. It forms the boundary between skydoms.

Astrals used these god-like beasts as weapons
during the War.

Astrals used these god-like beasts as weapons during the War. After the exile of
their former masters, many primals slept in the form of crystals or were
integrated into budding civilizations as objects of worship.

Primals can only be controlled by Astrals, and their rare but terrible rampages
are on the order of a natural catastrophe.

Though it is a well-known fable that Estalucia,
the Isle of the Astrals lies at the end of the
skies, there is no proof the island exists.

Though it is a well-known fable that Estalucia, the Isle of the Astrals, lies at
the end of the skies, there is no proof that the island exists. Scholars have
put forth many contending theories about what lies at sky's end, including the
presence of a great wall or a utopia of ease and comfort.

Since antiquity, skydwellers have told fables of
this mystical land, which grants the wishes of all
who reach its shores.

Since antiquity, skydwellers have told fables of this mystical land. Those who
land on its shores are promised untold knowledge and glory and the granting of
any wish.

Though  is determined to reach Estalucia, it is as shrouded in
mystery as the Astrals themselves. Many airships that went hunting the magical
thread of its tale have disappeared without a trace.

Lilith, taking advantage of the skydwellers' fascination with Estalucia,
promised her followers passage to the island in exchange for faith in primeval
gods. The Pilgrims of Avia quickly grew in number.

These guideposts are found in the possession of
powerful primal beasts. Collecting all of them
will yield a map to the end of the skies.

These guideposts are found only in the possession of powerful primal beasts who
have made a pact with the island on which they reside. Collecting all pieces
will yield a map to the end of the skies.

A mysterious and mystical form of energy that has
long existed in the Sky Realm, separate from the
power of primal beasts. Its wielders are known as
witches and sorcerers.

A mysterious and mystical form of energy that has long existed in the Sky Realm,
separate from the power of primal beasts. Its wielders are known as witches and
mages. Although a great magus is mighty enough to contend with a primal beast,
only a handful of individuals are capable of such mastery.

A bond formed of Lyria's power, that binds her
life and 's into one.

Struck by a fatal blow and wandering the liminal space between life and death,
 was brought back by Lyria, who used a mysterious power to
bestow half her soul. This bond inextricably tied up not only their lives, but also
their futures.

This mid-sized airship is home to 
and crew.

This mid-sized airship is home to  and crew. Though it appears
no different from ships of similar construction, the Grandcypher seems to possess
a mysterious power, at times responding to the thoughts of her passengers. She
shares a storied history with her helmsman, Rackam.

These skyfaring emblems are the only form of
transport between islands.

These skyfaring emblems are the only form of transport between islands.
Early airships were of purely Astral construction, but as technology in the Sky
Realm developed, so did its vessels. Modern airships contain a combination of
sky and Astral technology, customized to suit specific functions. However,
skydwellers have not yet pieced together how to build airships from scratch, and
if it were not for their Astral parts, these vessels would never leave the ground.

All who take to the wind in airships are called
skyfarers. Some are adventurers, striking out for
new territories; others mercenaries, selling their
monster-exterminating services. It's an occupation
that offers equal parts freedom, glory, and
danger.

All who take to the wind in airships are called skyfarers.
Some are adventurers, striking out for new territories; others mercenaries,
selling their monster-exterminating services. It's an occupation that offers
equal parts freedom, glory, and danger. The skies are filled with all sorts of
creatures, many of them hostile, and to sail in any direction means to sail into
battle. For this reason, veteran skyfaring crews often become legends.

The pilot of an airship. A good helmsman is
familiar not only with a ship and steering wheel,
but also the whole of the skies—its geography,
climates, and air currents.

The pilot of an airship. A good helmsman is familiar not only with a ship and
steering wheel, but also the whole of the skies—its geography, climates, and air
currents.

Though airships are extremely complex vessels utilizing the potent technology
of Astrals, their flight control systems are surprisingly simple, and even a
novice can operate one over short distances. However, the skies are nothing if
not unpredictable, and any self-respecting crew needs a skilled helmsman to
navigate its twist and turns.

These powerful beings act as guardian deities to
the islands of Zegagrande. For the Pilgrims of
Avia, they are objects of worship, and as the
influence of this faith burgeons, so too does the
veneration of primeval gods.

These powerful beings act as guardian deities to the islands of Zegagrande. For
the Pilgrims of Avia, they are objects of worship, and as the influence of this
faith burgeons, so too does the veneration of primeval gods.

In other skydoms, these entities are known as primal beasts and many are also
deified—a common practice in the Sky Realm. In Zegagrande, skydwellers have
worshipped primals since the days of the War and the name "primeval god" is a
relic from that time.

Primeval gods are enshrined at altars, the grounds
of which are considered sacred in Zegagrande.

Primeval gods are enshrined at altars, the grounds of which are considered
sacred in Zegagrande. Pilgrimage to these sites are a large part of local
culture, as it's believed the journeys bring good fortune.

A Folcan restaurant conceived this creamy soup,
concocted of locally sourced wheat and vegetables.

A Folcan restaurant conceived this creamy soup, concocted of locally sourced
wheat and vegetables. Though most recipes call for stewing the broth over a
long period with jerked meat, different households and islands have brewed
up their own varieties.

This wireless device is capable of transmitting
sound over long distances. Transceivers are rare
and extremely costly, and not many skydwellers
even know of their existence.

This wireless device is capable of transmitting sound over long distances.
Transceivers are rare and extremely costly, and not many skydwellers even
know of their existence.

Vyrn owns a model of limited range, handcrafted by Rolan.

These monoliths store primal energies that flow
through islands, warding off malignant monsters
and goblins. They can be found throughout
Zegagrande Skydom.

These monoliths store primal energies that flow through islands, creating
magnetic fields that ward off malignant monsters and goblins. They can be found
throughout Zegagrande Skydom and are often used by travelers and merchants as
safe resting spots.

This scarlet airship is the regular conveyance 
of Lilith, leader of the Church of Avia.

This scarlet airship is the regular conveyance of Lilith, leader of the Church
of Avia. It's one of many vessels controlled by the religious group, which
at one time was even known to go on pilgrimage in flotillas.

Some of the Avia faithful, upon seeing Ameretat's approach, will prostrate
themselves in its shadow.

This battle gear was a gift from Rolan to
. Its name is an expression
of defiance against the Church of Avia.

After having both body and spirit crushed in battle by Id,  was
gifted a new set of battle gear by Rolan. Its name is an expression of
defiance against the Church of Avia.
This cannon uses ether energy as ammunition.

This cannon uses ether energy as ammunition. Details about its conception are
discussed in this rather passionate report:
 
"In the past, the gunpowder-and-metal cannon was your main type of ordnance.
However, these pieces took time to load and could backfire or discharge early,
inflicting heavy casualties on allied troops. They were also ill-suited for airship
use, as barrels sturdy enough to withstand the firing of cannonballs were also
extremely heavy.
 
In order to bypass these inconveniences, the ether cannon was invented. This
artillery piece is capable of firing as long as its barrel holds and there's ether
energy to be had—no loading required.
 
Though a shot from an ether cannon will be both slower and weaker than one
from a gunpowder cannon of the same caliber, the ether model is still extremely
destructive. It is capable of shooting a continuous beam at one target, instigating
a rapid buildup of thermodynamic energy. Shots do not arc, as cannonballs do,
but rather fly in a straight line. This makes ether cannons easy to manipulate and
especially suited for airborne battle, where targets may dodge up or down, as
well as in the four cardinal directions, at high speeds.
 
This new form of ordnance, however, is not without its faults; the barrel, for
example, is extremely prone to overheating after rapid fire. But given its
remarkable compatibility with airships, it may be safely assumed that the ether
cannon is the heavy artillery piece of the future."

A small model of airship employed by the Aviaeth
fleet.

A small model of airship employed by the Aviaeth fleet. Its features are
detailed in the following report:
 
"The Vaza'ite Raptor is light and quick, well-suited for hit-and-run maneuvers
or conveying paratroopers in ambush attacks. Each airship is also equipped with
a small caliber ether cannon.
 
The main tactical advantage of this model, however, may lie in its aptness to
mass production. The church currently employs over one hundred Vaza'ite
Raptors, used in conjunction with large, heavily-armored warships. A favorite
tactic of their fleet: to shell the enemy from afar with the warships, while
conducting close-combat swooping maneuvers with the Raptors.
 
Addendum: While the Raptor is technically capable of inter-island travel, the
body of the airship is cramped and prone to turbulence, and long-distance
flights are not advised."

The Church of Avia used this magical collar as a
mind-control device.

The Church of Avia used this magical collar as a mind-control device. It
manipulates psychic waves, suppressing and sealing away memories and emotions.
The victim is then transformed into a mindless puppet, whose strings are then
plied by the master of the implement.

The device was originally employed for emotional therapy, but because its power
was so easily abused, its utilization was eventually banned, even by Avia.

Lilith used a mind sealer fifteen years ago at the time of the Dahli Catastrophe
to seal Bahamut Versa in the then-juvenile Id.

This magical device, capable of counteracting the
effects of the mind sealer, is sealed away beneath
ruins on Dahli Island.

This magical device, capable of counteracting the effects of the mind sealer, is
sealed away beneath ruins on Dahli Island. Its original use, as its name
suggests, was to catalyze magical reactions; this same capacity, applied to the
mind sealer, neutralizes the magic of the collar by causing it to overheat. On
the bottom of the catalyst stone, faint Astral letters can be made out spelling
"Dehg"—likely the device's inventor.

A tragedy that took place fifteen years ago, which
began when a huge swath of Dahli Island was 
pulverized in an explosion.

A tragedy that took place fifteen years ago, which began when a huge swath 
of Dahli Island was pulverized in an explosion. Survivors, many of whom 
escaped to Folca or Seedhollow, believe the gods smote them with 
retribution for their avarice.

These crystals were developed out of the Erste Empire's extensive research on
Lyria and primal beasts. They are capable of infusing a skydwelling mortal with
vast, Astral-like power. However, as neither Astrals nor their power are native
to the skies, the effects of dark essence are unstable and rife with risk.

This rare, Sundappled Grove-dwelling herb contains
faint traces of Astral magic, which can nullify an
excess of wind energy in the body.

This rare, Sundappled Grove-dwelling herb contains faint traces of Astral magic,
which can nullify an excess of wind energy in the body. There are rumors it was
introduced to the region by a mysterious man who once saved Folca.

This extremely rare illness is actually born from
a blessing—sometimes, the warding wind magic of
Furycane proves too potent for the mortal body,
causing it to deteriorate.

This extremely rare illness is actually born from a blessing—sometimes, the
warding wind magic of Furycane proves too potent for the mortal body, causing
it to deteriorate.

Because Furycane's influence has declined in recent years, the number of people 
afflicted by the Withering has dwindled into obscurity, and many believe the
disease to be extinct.

The velvety golden yolk from just one of these
mammoth eggs can make an omelet to revitalize 
ten grown men.

The velvety golden yolk from just one of these mammoth eggs can make an omelet
to revitalize ten grown men. The journey to obtain wraithwing eggs, however, is
extremely dangerous; it's no wonder they're so rarely seen at market. The few who
have tasted this delectation all report it to be highly nutritious and rich with flavor.

This monster grease is extracted from
desert-dwelling slimes. It's extremely rare, but
utterly useless.

This monster grease is extracted from desert-dwelling slimes. Though extremely
rare, desert oil is utterly useless. No one in possession of all five of their senses
would ever think of using it as a food ingredient.

A small-scale shipping vessel once a key part of
Folca and Tempeal's mining industry logistics
chain.

A small-scale shipping vessel once a key part of Folca and Tempeal's mining
industry logistics chain. By limiting its payload and keeping the freighter
light, the crew of the Nautilus was able to fly at three times the speed of a
regular passenger ship. 

Due to wear and tear, the old vessel was scheduled to be scrapped in recent
years, but was then saved by the fervent efforts of a few scrappy young
technicians.

This translucent, palm-sized crystal piece is
infused with primal energy and glows faintly.

This translucent, palm-sized crystal piece is infused with primal energy and
glows faintly. Simply touching it can soothe a worried mind.

A crystallization of the Astral power that is the
lifeblood of all primal beasts. Draining a primal
dry of this energy will cause it to lose its
shape, 
effectively killing it.

A crystallization of the Astral power that is the lifeblood of all primal
beasts. Draining a primal dry of this energy will cause it to lose its shape,
in essence killing it.

This glowing green crystal brims with primal
energy and gives off its own magnetic field.

This glowing green crystal brims with primal energy and gives off its own
magnetic field, warding off malicious monsters and goblins.

Before its defeat, this terrible tyrant of beasts
kept all its subjects in terror. Its scales were
so thick no steel could pierce them, and even a
drop of its burning blood broiled with power.

Before its defeat, this terrible tyrant of beasts kept all its subjects in terror.
Its scales were so thick no steel could pierce them, and even a drop of
its burning blood broiled with power.

The most glorious tasting fish ever to grace
Auguste—but so rare that even a long-sailing 
local fisherman could count his Bonito encounters 
on the fingers of one hand.

The most glorious tasting fish ever to grace Auguste—but so rare that even
a long-sailing local fisherman could count his Bonito encounters on the fingers
of one hand.

When enjoyed raw, which can only happen when the fish is fresh out the water,
the sashimi is rumored to extend a person's lifespan; when eaten grilled with
herbs, the flavor is said to be so delectable it would make a dead man salivate.

This elusive fish is the subject of many a
Zegagrande fable.

This elusive fish is the subject of many a Zegagrande fable, where its scales
are set down as more brilliant than any gem and its dorsal fin as more
beautiful than any flower.

This legendary fish is said to be the biggest in
the skydom.

This legendary fish is said to be the biggest in the skydom. Though there have
been, unsurprisingly, many sightings of this behemoth, so far no one's found a
cable or boat sturdy enough to reel one in.

When egg-laying season rolls around, this cold
water fish will travel upstream from its frigid
home.

When egg-laying season rolls around, this cold water fish will travel upstream
from its frigid home. A mealtime favorite.

A school of martial arts founded by Ghandagoza,
which follows the mantra "The way of the fist is
the way to the universe." Masters are said to be
capable of splitting mountains and meteorites with
their bare hands.

A school of martial arts founded by Ghandagoza, which follows the mantra "The
way of the fist is the way to the universe." Masters are said to be capable of
splitting mountains and meteorites with their bare hands.

Now in his sunset years, Ghandagoza is desperately seeking a successor—and
 is at the top of his list.

This art, founded by Cagliostro, is capable of
effecting miraculous transformations on the world.

This art, founded by Cagliostro, is capable of effecting miraculous
transformations on the world. However, all its processes are governed by
fundamental principles, the foremost of which is the law of equivalent exchange.
Outside of a handful of exceptions, alchemy cannot create something from
nothing.

But the true value of alchemy may not lie in its capacity to change, but rather
in its capacity to reveal—by breaking this vast, confusing universe into its
most basic parts, alchemy may eventually unravel the mystery of existence.

This disease was first discovered by one Dr.
Lysiria. 
Its symptoms include high fevers and partial 
immobility due to paralysis of the nervous system.

This disease was first discovered by one Dr. Lysiria. Its symptoms include high
fevers and partial immobility due to paralysis of the nervous system. Both its
cause and treatment are as of yet unknown.

The most numerous type of skydweller,
well-balanced physically and mentally, and full of
curiosity.

The most numerous type of skydweller, well-balanced physically and mentally, and
full of curiosity. Generally creative and intelligent, many Humans go on to become
inventors and manufacturers.

These slender beings sport animal ears and a
natural gift for magic.

These slender beings sport animal ears and a natural gift for magic. Ancient
Erunes preferred mountaintop dwellings, where they could pursue their studies in
peace, but recently, more and more of them have moved into bustling cities
and towns. For some reason they tend to wear clothing with open backs.

These small, pointy-eared skydwellers are
extremely logical, making them shrewd
businesspeople.

These small, pointy-eared skydwellers are extremely logical, making them shrewd
businesspeople. Though physically ill-suited for combat, Harvins also possess
indomitable wills and courage.

These horned skydwellers are sturdily built, and
their physical strength make them excellent
ironworkers and carpenters.

These horned skydwellers are sturdily built, and their physical strength make
them excellent ironworkers and carpenters. However, most do not have an affinity
with magic.

This splendidly armored primal beast presided over
combat, destined to live all her life by the sword. 
She was once an Astral, famed for her physical 
prowess and tactician's wit—even then, many called
her a god of war.

This splendidly armored primal beast presided over combat, destined to live all
her life by the sword. She was once an Astral, famed for her physical prowess
and tactician's wit—even then, many called her a god of war.

In her Astral days, Ares had a fondness for the Sky Realm and even became a
naturalized citizen. When the War erupted, she fought in it and died, only
to be revived as a primal beast by a mysterious Astral known only as "Snake."
She spent much of this second life wandering the Otherworld, but with Katalina's
help, was able to let go of all her regrets and move on once and for all. Her
power she left behind to Katalina, with whom she had bonded.

This primal beast of wind slumbered for a long
time at Port Breeze, blessing its adventurers and
tradesmen, and bringing the archipelago fabulous
fortune.

This primal beast of wind slumbered for a long time at Port Breeze, blessing its
adventurers and tradesmen, and bringing the archipelago fabulous fortune. Her
rampages, however, summon terrible destruction, whipping up winds to rival the
tumult of the Grim Basin.

She shares a bond with Rackam, who completed the "Innermost Teachings," which
blessed him with her power.

Noa's primal beast dominion is shipbuilding, and
the Grandcypher was his handiwork. He and Rackam
go way back to the helmsman's youth, when the two
exchanged a vow.

Noa's primal beast dominion is shipbuilding, and the Grandcypher was his
handiwork. He and Rackam go way back to the helmsman's youth, when the two
exchanged a vow. This promise has become a well of courage for Rackam, and he
draws from it whenever the Grandcypher tumbles and his will to fly withers.

This metal-plated primal beast was born from
tragedy. Its monumental body seems to echo with
the cries of every person ever wronged.

This metal-plated behemoth was born from tragedy. Its monumental body
seems to echo with the cries of every person ever wronged. Though it runs
on Astral technology, its frame was beat out of Sky Realm ironwork—making
Colossus one of the few primal beasts ever to be built by skydwelling hands.

This serpentine primal beast presides over waters
of healing and good fortune. It slumbers on the
Auguste Isles.

This serpentine primal beast presides over waters of healing and good fortune.
It slumbers on the Auguste Isles—one of the few places in the Sky Realm washed
by the sea.

Auguste's aquatic landscapes actually sprung from Leviathan's energy and have
the power to heal both man and nature. The Augustean sea especially has
become a popular tourist destination since the end of the War.

Leviathan shares a bond with Eugen, who completed the "Innermost Teachings,"
which blessed him with its power.

Konohanasakuya's primal beast dominion is 
"blossoming"—and this power extends beyond
flowers to touch the potential of all living
things.

Konohanasakuya's primal beast dominion is "blossoming"—and though the source of
Seedhollow's prolific blooms, this power extends beyond flowers to touch the
potential of all living things.

This primal beast, in the form of a miasma-cloaked
ship, wanders the skies above Tramont Island,
robbing all its inhabitants of death.

This primal beast once wandered the skies aimlessly in the form of a
miasma-cloaked ship. That was until a pandemic gripped the neighbors, friends,
and family of a young girl named Ferry. Her prayers summoned Celeste to the
foggy isle of Tramont, where the strange being exerted its influence to rob all
the inhabitants of a true death.

The native skydom of the Grandcypher and its crew,
home to gentle breezes and islands such as
Zinkenstill and the Port Breeze Archipelago.

The native skydom of the Grandcypher and its crew, home to gentle breezes and
islands such as Zinkenstill and the Port Breeze Archipelago. It boasts a rich,
self-sustaining economy, so few denizens find the turbulent passage across the
Grim Basin into new lands worth the danger.

In the past, due to the incursions of the Erste Empire, clashes among
Phantagrande islands were a frequent occurrence. It wasn't until
 helped to orchestrate the downfall of the tyrannical imperials that
peace could resume its broken reign.

Nalhegrande shares a border with Phantagrande, and along this junction looms
the frost-blown continent of North Vast. In its frigid atmosphere floats an
ancient structure, shaped like a wall and the size of an island, so remarkable
that it's described even in the documents of foreign skydoms.

Here the Istavion Kingdom reigns supreme. It was due to the influence of this
monarchy, which is fabulously wealthy and owns vast tracts of land, that the
descriptor "Great" was affixed to the name of Oarlyegrande. The skydom
contains seven islands, each governing over a specific aspect of its society—
education, recreation, economy, justice, and so on.

's newest adventure unfolds across 
this western stretch of sky, home to islands such
as Leautagne and the Ainsteddo Archipelago.

's newest adventure unfolds across this western stretch of sky,
home to islands such as Leautagne and the Ainsteddo Archipelago. It is cut off
from the rest of the world by a particularly thick and churning stretch of the Grim
Basin, through which very few airships can or are willing to fly. Due to this dearth
of foreign interaction, Zegagrande is also known as "the forgotten skydom."

Five hundred years ago, this expanse was ruled by the Seedhollow Empire, which
converted into a republic following the Sky Realm victory in the War. Since then,
Seedhollow has become a political and economic hub.

This verdant forest once bequeathed its natural
riches unto the people of Folca.

This verdant forest once bequeathed its natural riches unto the people of Folca.
Now, heeding warnings from the local Defense Corps, townsfolk no longer wander
in the shade of its generous canopy.

This small island has a self-sustaining economy,
prompting little traffic to pass through its
borders. In its heart grows a forest, where prisms
can be harvested.

This small island has a self-sustaining economy, prompting little traffic to
pass through its borders. In its heart grows a forest, where prisms can be
harvested.

Despite Zinkenstill's relative isolation, its people are warm and sociable. There 
aren't any famous landmarks or local specialties, as the tourism industry never
took off here, but the charming and rustic towns make a pleasant getaway.

This windy archipelago is a favorite gathering
spot of skyfarers and tradespeople. Its busiest
port may be found on Eingana Island, which boasts
a bustling market at its center.

This group of islands, blessed by the primal beast Tiamat to enjoy gentle,
steady winds, is a favorite gathering spot of skyfarers and tradespeople. Its
busiest port may be found on Eingana Island, which boasts a bustling market
at its center.

Though the climate on Port Breeze is generally mild, it may be a little cold for
more delicate constitutions because of the constant gusts.

This idyllic settlement, also known as
the "Windswept Township," lies near the border
of Zegagrande.

This idyllic settlement, also known as the "Windswept Township," lies near the
border of Zegagrande.

Back in the far reaches of history, Folca started out as a tiny village, inhabited
by no more than a handful of skydwellers. But after the discovery of a
bountiful ore vein, followed by the establishment of the mines of Tempeal,
Folca has shot to prominence as an exporter of fine metals.

Since the disappearance of Rolan, aka Mr. Fix It, locals have been plagued by a
swelling tide of monsters. This wave is only just being suppressed by a
mysterious young newcomer, who has stepped into Rolan's shoes.

The land here seems alive with the heat and pulse
of fire. It boasts the largest metalworking
factory in all of Phantagrande, which runs day and night.

Great subterranean rivers of magma flow here, which imbues the land with the
life and heat of fire. Perhaps for this reason, many Draphs reside in Valtz
Duchy, pursuing metalwork at the largest factory in the skydom, which runs day
and night.

Valtz metalwork is known to be as durable as it is beautiful, selling for high
prices all across Phantagrande.

This archipelago, brimming with the light and life
of water, is an autonomous district established
for the purposes of trade. As such, it is not
beholden to any of its surrounding governments.

This archipelago, brimming with the light and life of water, is an autonomous
district established for the purposes of trade. As such, it is not beholden to
any of its surrounding governments.

Auguste is the only known region in Phantagrande to possess an aquatic body big
enough to be called a sea, which attracts swarms of tourists each year. It also
boasts a prolific marketplace, the tax revenue from which allows the district to
maintain a mercenary defense force rivaling any national army.
A mining settlement famed for its rare ores.

A mining settlement famed for its rare ores. An altar enshrining a primeval god
lies within the surrounding mountains, and legend says that this deity watches
over the miners and guides them to the thick, shimmering veins of metal and
minerals.

All ore out of Tempeal is first shipped to Folca to be processed, after which it
is exported to the rest of Zegagrande Skydom.

This mountainous archipelago lies in the west of
Zegagrande. Its thriving towns and villages are 
blessed by perpetual spring.

This mountainous archipelago lies in the west of Zegagrande. Its thriving towns 
and villages are blessed by perpetual spring. Unfortunately, people, crops, and
animals aren't the only things that flourish in this mild climate, and both the
economic hub of Folca and the mining settlement of Tempeal are plagued by
monster attacks on its trade routes.

This ancient structure was a stronghold during
the War, on the skydweller's side. In recent
years, however, it has been claimed by goblins.

This ancient structure was a stronghold during the War, on the skydweller's
side. Following the defeat and exile of the Astrals, a merchant named Zeghard
refurbished the place, turning it into a gladiator's arena that pitted monsters
against one another. This macabre entertainment, however, failed to gain any
traction, and the arena was soon closed and abandoned.

Now, after years of inactivity, the fort is once again teeming with life—in the
form of goblin squatters.

This huge island is threaded throughout with
mountain ranges, with the highest peak, Mt.
Neigelith, piercing the underbelly of the clouds.

This huge island is threaded throughout with mountain ranges, with the highest
peak, Mt. Neigelith, piercing the underbelly of the clouds. Leautagne is blasted
with snow throughout the year—miserable for locals, but in summer, ice is 
carted down from its mountains and exported to neighboring islands as frozen 
treats.

Deep in the heart of this frigid region lies Tredame Sanctum, where the primeval
god Managarmr is enshrined. Despite Leautagne's inhospitable climate, it gets
more than a few pilgrims.

This towering peak is beset by frequent,
savage snowstorms and can boast of few
inhabitants besides monsters and the Mellose clan.

This towering peak is beset by frequent, savage snowstorms and can boast 
of few inhabitants besides monsters and the Mellose clan.

The bottom of this deep gorge, nestled between the
crags of Mt. Neigelith, teems with monsters. Very
few who fall into its shadow ever return.

It's said this gorge was first formed as a fissure in the ice of Mt. Neigelith,
which grew progressively wider and deeper as the frost thawed and hardened. 
Now, monsters live in its depths—and few who fall down there ever return.

This monumental continent brushes against the
northern border of Phantagrande. Most of its
interior—as of yet undeveloped—is the subject of
frequent land disputes between competing national
interests.

This monumental continent brushes against the northern border of Phantagrande.
Most of its interior—as of yet undeveloped—is the subject of frequent land
disputes between competing national interests. This general chaos has also drawn
in gangs of outlaws, enmeshed in their own turf wars.

Parts of the continent, including the Eoniho Mountains, jut out into the
shrieking, cutting winds of the Grim Basin. For all these reasons, North Vast is
considered the harshest piece of land ever to float in the Phantagrande Skydom.

This holy land, nestled in the snowy bosom of Mt.
Neigelith, enshrines the primeval god worshipped
by the Mellose clan.

This holy land, nestled in the snowy bosom of Mt. Neigelith, enshrines the
primeval god worshipped by the Mellose clan. To reach the shrine, a pilgrim must
pass through a series of thick sealed doors, which only the monastery overseer
has the power to open.

This island floats in the heart of
Zegagrande—small, but densely populated, as it
contains the city of Seedhollow, the skydom's
foremost economic hub.

This island floats in the heart of Zegagrande—small, but densely populated, as
it contains the city of Seedhollow, the skydom's foremost economic hub.
Almerain typically enjoys balmy weather year-round, with a good mixture of
sunshine and rain, and its summers are dry and temperate.

This Almerainean city, famed for its beautiful
gardens and architecture, is the most highly
populated in Zegagrande.

This Almerainean city, famed for its beautiful gardens and architecture, is the
most highly populated in Zegagrande. It's surrounded by plots of rich soil on
which floriculturists ply their trade, but, owing to the small size of the island
it sits on, is quickly running out of new land to develop.

Seedhollow was an empire before the War, then transitioned into a republic
afterwards. Nowadays, it's a relatively peaceful settlement, though there is a
running undercurrent of tension between its ridiculously upper crust Golden Oaks
nobles and its miserably impoverished Copper Square residents.

Although Avia's invasion caused considerable damage to Seedhollow, the 
evacuation of the citizens proceeded smoothly, and casualties were kept to
a minimum thanks to the efforts of Seedhollow's soldiers and the Family Zathba.

It is also due to the ongoing contributions—both conventional and 
unconventional—of Zathba and his group that Seedhollow has been able to 
quickly pick itself up after the incursion and get a running start on the path
back to its former glory.

This magnificent structure was a skydweller
stronghold during the War.

During the War, this magnificent structure was a skydweller redoubt, supervised
by an imperial family known as the Skylords. Following the defeat and banishment
of the Astrals, Seedhollow transitioned into a republic, and the redoubt opened
its gates to local and foreign tourists alike.

Nowadays, Seedhollow Castle is used as a conference hall and a base for military
operations.

According to Rolan, Angra Mainyu is sealed below the castle, with its reclamation
being the impetus for Avia's attack on Seedhollow.

The crew eventually arrived and repelled the Aviaeth forces, but not before Lilith
had raised the Pillar of Vayoi, destroying a swath of the city.

With the skies rid of a great terror, plans were quickly drafted to restore 
Seedhollow. The city council, still shaken by the humiliation they suffered at
the hands of Avia, has taken this opportunity to discuss a restructuring of the
military.

Both the local smithy and reception for the Crew
Alliance Rafale are situated in this busy
marketplace, part of Seedhollow's third district.

Both the local smithy and reception for the Crew Alliance Rafale are situated in
this busy marketplace, part of Seedhollow's third district. It draws in flocks
of tourists from all over Zegagrande, who come to shop among colorful stalls and
marvel at the shocks of flowers blooming wildly in the nearby community plaza.

Much of this region has been claimed by desert, in
whose embrace lie huge ruins rumored to be filled
with treasure.

Much of this region has been claimed by desert, in whose embrace lie huge ruins
rumored to be filled with treasure. Besides its artifacts, Dahli is blessed with all
kinds of mineral resources and, in the past, bustled with merchant activity. A 
catastrophe fifteen years ago cut all this short.

With their homes and livelihoods ruined, local residents were forced to evacuate, 
and all marks of civilization were buried in sand. Dahli is still a ghost island to
this day.

This long and narrow zone in the Dahli desert is
spotted with ruins.

This long and narrow zone in the Dahli desert is spotted with ruins. Every once
in a while, the council of Seedhollow will dispatch a crew here to search the
sands for clues about the Dahli Catastrophe that took place fifteen years ago.
So far, however, only monsters have been discovered among the dunes.

This ancient metropolis was populated until
fifteen years ago, when it was devastated in 
the Dahli Catastrophe.

This ancient metropolis was populated until fifteen years ago, when it was
devastated in the Dahli Catastrophe. Here there are strange devices that run on 
primal power, which seem connected to the circular ruins in the center of the
desert.

This tumultuous little island floats a short
distance away from the Dahli Relicbelt, 
spewing lava from its craggy surface.

This tumultuous little island floats a short distance away from the Dahli
Relicbelt, spewing lava from its craggy surface. A shrine to a primeval god
squats near the perimeter. Recently, however, it hasn't seen much pilgrimage, 
as an increase in volcanic activity and the resultant tectonic shifts have led to
Seedhollow declaring a moratorium on all Phondam-bound flights.

This structure is formed of various parts—streets,
buildings, earth—wrested away from Zegagrande 
islands and cobbled together into a nightmare 
monolith.

This structure is formed of various parts—streets, buildings, earth—wrested 
away from Zegagrande islands and cobbled together into a nightmare monolith. 
Dark magic hangs heavy in the air, while monsters spawned from Angra Mainyu 
pace the warped corridors.

This fertile archipelago is populated with ancient
trees, some of which stood witness to the invasion
of the Astrals and the ensuing War.

This fertile archipelago is populated with ancient trees, some of which stood
witness to the invasion of the Astrals and the ensuing War. Despite its
monumental age, the forest is still flourishing, still growing, thanks to the
power of the resident primal beast, Yggdrasil.

Like all thickly wooded lands, Lumacie is haunted by legends and bugbears, and
mysterious ruins lie deep in its heart. It is also home to much unique flora,
though very few researchers dare to wander in the unpredictable shade of its
canopy.

Shrouded in fog all year long, this desolate land
is home to just one sparsely populated village.

Though only a thin stream of traffic trickled to and from the island—home to
just one sparsely populated village—visiting skyfarers have reported Tramont
locals to be warm and generous. However, many decades ago, a thick fog
encroached upon the region, making the airspace too dangerous for flight.

This exceptional kingdom owes much of its prestige
to the blessings of the primal beast Sylph. Her
elaborate handicrafts—including an eternal youth
potion called "Alma"—have gone a long way in
filling the national coffers.

This exceptional kingdom owes much of its prestige to the blessings of the
primal beast Sylph. Her elaborate handicrafts—including an eternal youth potion
called "Alma"—have gone a long way in filling the national coffers. For this
reason, buildings in the royal capital bear a crest modeled after Sylph's wings,
and the light filtering through these translucent emblems bathes the city in a
dreamlike glow.

Feendrache is rich in natural resources, but these rivers, fields, and forests
are also home to countless monsters.

A domain on Almerain Island that shares a name
with its ruling family.

A domain on Almerain Island that shares a name with its ruling family. Despite
having governed for hundreds of years, the Lords of Grosgard have been, without
exception, diligent people; under their watchful eye, the realm, though too small 
to sustain large scale manufacturing, has nonetheless blossomed into a quiet
paradise.

As its name suggests, this vale on the Ainsteddo
Archipelago is overrun by wyverns.

As its name suggests, this vale on the Ainsteddo Archipelago is overrun by
wyverns. In recent times the monster presence has increased to include other
species, including goblins—and all these hassle and plunder merchant caravans
passing through the area.

This nation, ruled by a saint-king and home to the
magnificent Church of Clemont, was founded by the
Lumiel Order of Holy Knights—itself formed up
during the War to protect and serve the starving
populace.

This nation, ruled by a saint-king and home to the magnificent Church of
Clemont, was founded by the Lumiel Order of Holy Knights—itself formed up 
during the War to protect and serve the starving populace.

Once, this power-hungry nation had nearly the
entire Phantagrande Skydom under its thumb.

Once, this power-hungry nation had nearly the entire Phantagrande Skydom under
its thumb. Its schemes were exposed and its ambitions crushed, however, by 
 and crew, who restored Queen Orchis to her throne. Erste then
regained its status as a kingdom, and all elements of the empire were dismantled
and absorbed by this new government.

Another name for the Pilgrims of Avia, led by
Lilith. They worship primal beasts—whom they call
primeval gods—and promise salvation through an
ultimate pilgrimage to Estalucia.

Another name for the Pilgrims of Avia, led by Lilith. They worship primal
beasts—whom they call primeval gods—and promise salvation through an ultimate
pilgrimage to Estalucia. This religious group wields as much power as a large
country, and their highly trained and technologically advanced military, led by three
fearsome generals, are as mighty a force as any national army.

All this, however, is a front for a far darker purpose. Unbeknownst to any of
her followers, Lilith is an Astral. Her true goal is to sacrifice the skies to the
primal beast Angra Mainyu, which would awaken its powers and open for her
a portal back home—the Astral Realm.

This elite military corps is led by Gallanza, one
of the three Aviaeth generals. Hopefuls are
recruited from the main body of the Church of
Avia, then put through harsh, almost soul-crushing
training.

This elite military group is led by Gallanza, one of the three Aviaeth generals.
Hopefuls are recruited from the main body of the Church of Avia, then put
through harsh, almost soul-crushing training.

Once in the corps, crusaders are given all the weaponry and military gear they
would ever need. Thanks to the discipline and religious faith of its members, as
well as the supermortal strength of its general, the Silver Wolf Corps commands
more power than the army of a mid-sized country.

An order of monks from the Mellose clan, led by
Historiath. They dwell in the harsh environment of
Mt. Neigelith, observing strict precepts and
worshipping the primeval god enshrined at Tredame
Sanctum.

An order of monks from the Mellose clan, led by Historiath. They dwell in the
harsh environment of Mt. Neigelith, observing strict precepts and worshipping
the primeval god enshrined at Tredame Sanctum. Many also patrol the grounds,
warning away curious intruders, as the path of pilgrimage passes through
territory teeming with monsters.

An organization of extremely well-connected
informants based in Seedhollow.

An organization of extremely well-connected informants based in Seedhollow.
They also function as a kind of volunteer defense force, moving to stamp out
trouble wherever they get a whiff of it. For this reason, they're loved and
trusted by both the army and the general citizenry of Seedhollow. The members
of the Family Zathba aren't actually related, but their respect for their boss
Zathba is thicker than any blood.

This secretive all-Harvin regiment is led by
Maglielle, one of the three Aviaeth generals. In
combat, its members manipulate levitating swords.

This secretive all-Harvin regiment is led by Maglielle, one of the three Aviaeth
generals. Its members regard each other as family, and loyalty runs higher than
even in the Silver Wolf Corps. In combat, these warriors manipulate levitating
swords.

This knightly order—based in beautiful,
Sylph-blessed Feendrache—protects the royal
capital and its surrounding environs.

This knightly order—based in beautiful, Sylph-blessed Feendrache—protects the
royal capital and its surrounding environs.

Discipline among the White Dragons is strict. In particular, members are
absolutely banned from engaging in meaningless conflict—a rule most have no
problem following, thanks to the strong example set by their captain, Lancelot.

This military order guarded Feendrache before the
advent of the White Dragons.

This military order, captained by Siegfried and jointly vice-captained by Lancelot
and Percival, guarded Feendrache before the advent of the White Dragons.

It was forced to restructure by a certain incident, during which time Lancelot
ascended to the position of captain and the whole organization was renamed
the Order of the White Dragons.

This so-called knightly order was formed up by a
group of children to protect the peace of Folca.

This so-called knightly order was formed up by a group of children to protect
the peace of Folca. They apparently think that this is best accomplished by
catching bugs and going swimming in the nearby river.

A noble family of the bluest blood, which churns
out one monarch after another. Their influence has
seen a meteoric rise in recent years, especially
in the sphere surrounding Feendrache.
Percival hails from this clan.

A noble family of the bluest blood, which churns out one monarch after another.
Their influence has seen a meteoric rise in recent years, especially in the sphere
surrounding Feendrache. Percival hails from this clan.

The House of Wales observes an ancient tradition, sending their heirs to allied
countries, including Feendrache, where they serve as knights.

This autonomous group is comprised solely of
private citizens.

This autonomous group is comprised solely of private citizens. Because Folca
hasn't seen any real battle with either monsters or people for many years, the
Defense Corps has forgotten their training and become a herd of gadabouts.

The pride and strength of Lumiel, this chivalrous
band exists to defend the weak. Their motto
is "Forever pure, forever righteous."

The pride and strength of Lumiel, this chivalrous band exists to defend the
weak. Their motto is "Forever pure, forever righteous." The Lumiel Order
is famed not just in its homeland, but across the skies, and the current
captain, Charlotta, is said to be the mightiest holy knight that ever lived.

An alliance by skyfarers, for skyfarers. It
collects requests and missions—which can range
from monster exterminations to cat rescues—from
all across the skydom, then assigns them to
skyfaring crews.

An alliance by skyfarers, for skyfarers. It collects requests and missions—which
can range from monster exterminations to cat rescues—from all across the skydom,
then assigns them to skyfaring crews. Generally speaking, Rafale is no more than
an intermediary agency and most job patrons are islanders. Only in times of
emergency does the alliance send out its own calls to action.

The organization to which Zeta and Vaseraga belong. Though its objectives are
shrouded in mystery, its might is clear—they dispatch agents armed with unique
seal weapons all across the skies to tirelessly hunt primal beasts.

A special type of weapon used by members of the Society, such as Zeta and 
Vaseraga. These armaments are capable of absorbing the power of primal 
beasts and even killing them, but their use demands extraordinary expertise. 
For this reason, only a select few within the organization are allowed to 
wield them.

The mysterious denizens of the moon. They lack a spoken language, 
communicating instead through electronic tones. They prize logical thought 
and have a mechanical way of perceiving and interacting with the world. 
They struggle to understand and frequently exhibit contempt for illogical 
decisions and actions.

A nasty surprise lurks within the dormant seal weapons excavated by the Society
and their sworn enemy, the Foe. A seal weapon is capable of transforming into
an automagod, a fearsome automaton so powerful it can rip apart primal beasts
with ease. Automagods originate from the moon, and their exterior is lined with
a cell-like metallic substance to help protect the seal weapon that serves as
its core. Including Pyet-A, three are known to currently exist.

Considering that automagods view skydwellers with hostility, in addition to a
previous incident in which Vaseraga demonstrated signs of automagodification,
some have argued against the continued utilization of seal weapons. However, due
to a lack of substantial evidence proving that every seal weapon behaves in a
similar manner, the powers that be have deemed it necessary to further observe
and study the strange weapons in their possession.
Carving a Path to Sky's End Part 1
Carving a Path to Sky's End Part 2
The Will of a Shooting Star

Tucked away on the secluded island of Zinkenstill,
nothing exciting ever seemed to happen to this
young man or his pal Vyrn. But that all changed
when a girl named Lyria arrived out of the blue.

On the remote island of Zinkenstill lived a young
man and his best pal, Vyrn. His father had
departed the island years ago, leaving for his son
a single letter with instructions to head to
Estalucia, island of the Astrals.
 
As if guided by the invisible hand of fate, the
young man crossed paths with Lyria, kicking off
his quest to track down his father. Over the
course of various events, he assembled a diverse
crew of allies from all over the Sky Realm,
becoming one of the youngest skyfaring captains to
traverse the big blue.

A militarized cult called the Church of Avia has
kidnapped Lyria, and this young man will stop at
nothing to get her back. Sporting new armor and
the Sword of Eos, courtesy of his newest ally
Rolan, he stands ready to punish Avia for their
crimes.

The battles against Avia's forces were arduous and
relentless, but in the end, victory arrived in the
form of Lyria's safe return. However, the joy of
reunion is short-lived. Lilith intends to
sacrifice the entire Sky Realm for her own
ambitions, and she must be stopped.

Bahamut Versa is defeated, Id is saved, and peace
reigns in the Sky Realm once more. With a serene
but unclear future ahead,  helps 
Id take up Rolan's mantle as Folca's local Mr. Fix It.

Id and the crew enter the dimensional rift for a
showdown with Bahamut Versa. The battle is brutal,
but with Rolan's aid, their combined strength is enough
to overcome Versa, thus securing Zegagrande's safety.
The adventure, however, continues: 's
father still awaits on Estalucia, the promised land
beyond the sky.

Tucked away on the secluded island of Zinkenstill,
nothing exciting ever seemed to happen to this
young woman or her pal Vyrn. But that all changed
when a girl named Lyria arrived out of the blue.

On the remote island of Zinkenstill lived a young
woman and her best pal, Vyrn. Her father had
departed the island years ago, leaving for his
daughter a single letter with instructions to head
to Estalucia, island of the Astrals.
 
As if guided by the invisible hand of fate, the
young woman crossed paths with Lyria, kicking off
her quest to track down her father. Over the
course of various events, she assembled a diverse
crew of allies from all over the Sky Realm,
becoming one of the youngest skyfaring captains to
traverse the big blue.

A militarized cult called the Church of Avia has
kidnapped Lyria, and this young woman will stop at
nothing to get her back. Sporting new armor and
the Sword of Eos, courtesy of her newest ally
Rolan, she stands ready to punish Avia for their
crimes.

The battles against Avia's forces were arduous and
relentless, but in the end, victory arrived in the
form of Lyria's safe return. However, the joy of
reunion is short-lived. Lilith intends to
sacrifice the entire Sky Realm for her own
ambitions, and she must be stopped.

Bahamut Versa is defeated, Id is saved, and peace
reigns in the Sky Realm once more. With a serene
but unclear future ahead,  helps Id
take up Rolan's mantle as Folca's local Mr. Fix It.

Id and the crew enter the dimensional rift for a
showdown with Bahamut Versa. The battle is brutal,
but with Rolan's aid, their combined strength is enough
to overcome Versa, thus securing Zegagrande's safety.
The adventure, however, continues: 's
father still awaits on Estalucia, the promised land
beyond the sky.

A knight who protects Lyria. Over time, her bond
with the girl has become ironclad, like family.

Though Katalina was once a devoted knight of the
Erste Empire, her allegiance shattered when she
discovered the cruel imperial experiments being
run on Lyria. They fled together, eventually
meeting  in the forests of 
Zinkenstill—an encounter which proved to be 
the beginning of a grand adventure.

A seasoned helmsman who pilots the Grandcypher.
His wit is almost as quick as his trigger finger.

Soaring through the sky on the airship
Grandcypher, Rackam has made a name for himself as
a skilled helmsman. An accident once caused him to
swear off the skies forever, but 
prompted him to take the helm once more. He has
since become a steadfast ally. Though blunt,
Rackam is remarkably caring and enjoys looking
after others.

A young mage who idolizes sophistication. She's
headstrong and tenacious—maybe even a little too
tenacious at times.

A budding mage who strives to become a proper
lady. When  and crew were visiting 
the Valtz Duchy, they aided her in the search for 
her missing master, Tzaka the Great. After they 
found him, she decided to join the crew on their
journey. Io is persistent and refuses to give up
in the face of adversity, but she can be
inflexible too.

Despite being haunted by his past, this old
warrior still has a lot of fight left in him. He
has much wisdom to impart, if you ignore his
frequent complaints about getting older.

A veteran soldier wracked with guilt. For years,
he served as a mercenary for his homeland, the
Auguste Isles, defying the Erste Empire at every
turn. Now he travels with 's crew  
to face up to his past. A crafty fellow, Eugen often
mystifies others with sayings accumulated from
his years of experience.

A mysterious woman who guides 's
crew throughout their journey. She once traveled 
the skies with 's father.

During 's travels, this enigmatic 
beauty charmed her way into the crew out of the
blue. She seems to know the answers to the
many mysteries plaguing their journey, but,
preferring the role of a mere observer, she
usually keeps her cards close to her heart.
Rosetta is the incarnation of the primal beast 
Rose Queen and has traveled with
's father in the past.

A young ghost who accidentally summoned Celeste,
the primal beast of death. Her afterlife was originally
spent in isolation, but after finding her lovable ghost
pets, her lonely days seemed like a thing of the past.

This ethereal girl lived on an island shrouded in
mist, hidden from the eyes of the world. When a
lethal illness plagued her island and family, she
prayed to the sky for a cure. Her prayers were
answered by a primal beast who granted her
immortality, but bound her to the island. 
 and the crew lifted the curse, 
releasing her from the chains of the past. 
Now Ferry travels the skies with the crew, 
and along for the ride are her spectral pets, 
which she describes as such:
 
Beppo: One skinny pup
Fugee: Like a ball with two horns
Nicola: Only one horn here
Geegee: Kind of rabbity?
Momo: Built like a tank

A knight who leads the Order of the White Dragons.
He earned the trust of the king and citizens of
Feendrache through his heroic endeavors.

A knight who leads the Order of the White Dragons,
having earned the trust of the king and citizens
of Feendrache through his heroic endeavors. He
travels the skies in search of knowledge that will
provide the foundation for his country's future.
In the past he served as vice-captain of the Order
of the Black Dragons alongside Percival, his good
friend and rival.

The vice-captain of Feendrache's Order of the
White Dragons. He is an ardent champion of justice
who despises evil.

Vane is the vice-captain of Feendrache's Order of
the White Dragons and childhood friend of
Lancelot's. As a champion of justice, he strives
to stamp out corruption. Possessing a
happy-go-lucky attitude, his good nature can
sometimes be a detriment—he often gets stuck
doing menial errands within the White Dragons
despite his rank. Nevertheless, his smile never
wavers as he sets about his tasks, no matter how
trivial.

This knight travels the skies in hopes of creating
his ideal country. He is known as the "Lord of
Flames" for his prowess with a sword and ability
to manipulate fire.

A knight who travels the world to better learn what it
means to be a just ruler. Referred to as the "Lord of
Flames," his prowess with a sword and ability to
manipulate fire are widely renowned. Having studied
the art of kingcraft from an early age, he feels a
powerful sense of responsibility towards his subjects,
thinking it his duty to protect any person in need.

An exceptional knight with a calm demeanor. After
falling victim to a court conspiracy, he fled his
country and became a tragic hero.

Calm, poised, and monstrously strong, Siegfried
rose to prominence after sealing away True Dragon
Fafnir. He was the hero of Feendrache, captain of
the Order of the Black Dragons—until the consul
general framed him and drove him out of the
kingdom. Clad in pitch-black armor and clutching a
greatsword, the power of a dragon dwells within
his body.

A knight who serves as the captain of the Lumiel
Order of Holy Knights. Though she is small in
stature, she wields her greatsword with aplomb.

When she was young, Charlotta's life was saved by
the Lumiel Order of Holy Knights. From that day
on, she trained and worked herself to the bone to
embody the principles of her saviors. Defying the
notion that Harvins are lacking in physical
prowess, she enlisted in the Lumiel Order and rose
up the ranks to become its captain. Although she
possesses a calm, steadfast demeanor, she
suffers from an inferiority complex over her
height and seeks a way to make herself taller.

A jolly old fisherman who's content with passing
his days atop his mountain home. He was once a
famed swordmaster with many pupils... But that was
a long time ago.

This laid-back old-timer used to be a swordsman of
great repute. In his prime, he mentored many
disciples—until he was betrayed by his most
trusted protégé. After this incident, he lost faith in his
swordsmanship and trekked into the mountains to
live as a hermit. Yodarha was perfectly content to
spend the rest of his days fishing, but when he
heard his best student was still committing
atrocities, he came out of retirement to settle
the score once and for all.

A swordswoman born to a long line of martial arts
masters. She has trained arduously to combine her 
family's martial arts and magic into her own style of
swordplay.

This swordswoman was born to a long line of martial
arts masters. Through arduous training, she succeeded
in merging her family's martial arts style and magic into
her own unique style of swordplay. Yet for all her
accomplishments, she won't be satisfied until a certain
master swordsman acknowledges her for who she is.
In the heat of battle she is aloof, but once she opens up,
she quickly reveals that she's all heart. She tends to
coddle those younger than her—especially kids—which
makes her a great babysitter.

Founder of the Eternal Rage style. He has
accomplished many legendary feats with his furious
fists.

This legendary founder of the Eternal Rage Style
believes in two things: his fists. That's how he
makes the impossible possible. Though he has
come far in his ascetic training, he continues his
journey to one day knock out the god of creation
with a single punch. At the same time, he keeps a
vigilant eye on , waiting for the 
right moment to name  as his
successor.

A daring warrior who hunts primal beasts for the
Society. Contractor to the seal weapon known
as Spear of Arvess, she often carries out missions
with her partner Vaseraga. Though they
occasionally butt heads, they sincerely trust each
other. Zeta continually hunts primal beasts
in search of greater power and blows her pay on
wild days off. She is an extremely powerful
mid-range attacker with her spear, and her speed
makes her excellent in aerial combat as well.

A daring warrior who hunts primal beasts for the
Society. Contractor to the seal weapon known
as Spear of Arvess, she uses her speed to great
effect in battle.

A Draph warrior who hunts primal beasts for the
Society. Contractor to the seal weapon known as
Great Scythe Grynoth, he often carries out
missions with his partner Zeta. He gives the
impression of being a terrifying monster, but in
reality he's a calm soul who kindly extends a
hand to the weak. Those who face him in battle
are overwhelmed by his ominous weapon and
his inability to feel pain. He wields his scythe to
protect those in need because of the guilt he
feels towards the allies and friends he couldn't
save.

A Draph warrior who hunts primal beasts for the
Society. Contractor to the seal weapon known as
Great Scythe Grynoth, he uses his incredible
strength and unyielding spirit to overwhelm his foes.

A brilliant mage who founded alchemy in the Sky
Realm. She has learned how to achieve virtual
immortality by regularly replacing her body with
new vessels that suit her tastes.

A brilliant mage who introduced alchemy to the Sky
Realm. She has achieved virtual immortality by
regularly replacing her body with new vessels,
which she customizes to match her proclivities.
The ultimate narcissist, she attempts to embody
her vision of the perfect cutie, though her true
personality leaps out from time to time. Extreme
in her confidence, she views all others as
incompetent—equally incompetent, but incompetent
nonetheless.

A fierce swordsman whose life was saved thanks to
the crew. He is wracked by guilt for the part he
played in Avia's schemes, and as atonement, has
taken up Rolan's mantle as Folca's new Mr. Fix It.

One of Avia's three generals. He protects his
liege with fierce swordsmanship. Though quiet, he
carries out Lilith's will faithfully and without
question.

Id had always blindly believed in Lilith, his mother
figure and shepherd of Avia. But as he spent more
time guarding Lyria, deemed the Shaman of
Salvation by Lilith, he began to doubt his mother's
righteousness. Those doubts played a role in his
defeat at the hands of 's crew.

Id joined 's crew in order to stop 
Lilith from achieving her diabolical goal. He vowed
to use his newfound draconic power for himself
instead of letting others continue to exploit it.

In a twist of a fate, with the crew's unshakeable
faith to back him, Id broke free from Bahamut's
influence. He took up his sword to help them
overcome the imposing dragon. But, in the ensuing
chaos, he and  were sucked into 
the pocket dimension created to seal Bahamut. 
Rolan leapt bravely after them, sacrificing himself 
to ensure their escape. Vowing to make amends for
Rolan's sacrifice and Avia's sins, Id took up the 
mantle of Folca's local Mr. Fix It.

and the crew enter the dimensional
rift for a showdown with Bahamut Versa. The battle
is brutal, but with Rolan's aid, their combined
strength is enough to overcome Versa, thus securing
Zegagrande's safety. In Folca, Id says he'll take up
Rolan's role and continue to be the local Mr. Fix Id.
Having accepted the dragon of destruction's power,
he is finally free of the cruel whims of fate. With
newfound memories in tow, he takes a fresh step
forward.

One of Avia's three generals. He protects his
liege with fierce swordsmanship.

One of Avia's three generals. Halberd at the
ready, he gives off an intimidating aura.

One of Avia's three generals, and the commander
of the mighty Silver Wolf Corps. With his fearsome
halberd in hand, calling this man intimidating
would be an understatement. He is constantly
searching for ever stronger foes and becomes
exhilarated whenever he finds a worthy opponent.

After crushing the competition from all over
Zegagrande at a brawler's invitational, Gallanza
felt he needed a new challenge. He was hoping to
challenge Astrals in Estalucia, but when he
discovered Lilith's plans to destroy the Sky
Realm, he denounced Avia's mission and fought
alongside 's crew.

One of Avia's three generals. She seems to employ
curious magic.

One of Avia's three generals, and the commander of
the secretive Sword Veil Fellowship. Though she
exudes elegance and grace while controlling her
weapons, calling this woman ruthless would be an
understatement. She gives no quarter when it comes
to fulfilling her duties.

The Sword Veil Fellowship is comprised of a
makeshift family of mages, ostracized from their
clans for their peculiar ability to manipulate
weapons. Under Maglielle's guidance, they found a
home with the Church of Avia, but when she
discovered Lilith's plans to destroy the Sky
Realm, she denounced Avia's mission and fought
alongside 's crew.

The mystifying shepherd of her so-called "Pilgrims
of Avia." She will stop at nothing to reach
Estalucia and bring salvation to the skies.

The enigmatic shepherd of the Pilgrims of Avia.
Her goal is to reach Estalucia and bring salvation
unto her flock.

Lilith is warm and magnanimous to her
congregation, but merciless and scathing to her
detractors. Unbeknownst to her followers, she is
an Astral, hellbent on reviving a
dimension-bending primal called Angra Mainyu to
open a gate to the Astral Realm. However, doing so
would release enough power that the whole of
Zegagrande Skydom would be obliterated in the
process.

Driven into a corner, Lilith fused with Angra
Mainyu, but even such a reckless measure wasn't
enough to overcome the crew. In a final act of
desperation, Lilith awakened Bahamut Versa, which
she had sealed in Id when he was a child. In doing
so, she hoped to bring about the destruction of
the Sky Realm, and in turn, its rebirth. The
dragon, gone berserk from its newfound freedom,
attacked her and sent her flying to the bottom of
the skies. As she fell, she was praying for a
different outcome, should her reborn world truly
come to pass.
Going for walks near the family home
Putting his fists to the test
Working as a collective toward a shared goal
Cute things, small animals, cooking (if you can call it that)
The pursuit of justice, virtuous people
Little Skyfarer's Lunches, high places, tall people
Meat, meat, more meat, strong competitors
Deathmatches, rice balls (like the ones Mom makes)
Expressing disagreement in an articulate manner
The pursuit of domination, evil people
Stairs, things on top of tall shelves
Admitting she can't stay awake when meditating
I do not know—I have never considered this matter.

The rashest, most truculent of goblins often become stormers, who charge down
their foes on the front lines of battle. However, they know nothing of courage
or honor, craving only the thrill of bloodshed and letting loose ecstatic war
cries that boost allied morale.

Goblins have developed their own complex societies, with some members adopting
specialized roles pertaining to the art of war. Witch doctors often form the
rear rank of goblin battalions, casting spells and hexes to turn the tides of
battle. These magi are sly, even for goblins, and delight in hounding prey.

Goblins have developed their own complex societies, with some members adopting
specialized roles pertaining to the art of war. Goblin tankers are tasked with
screening their allies behind thick shields; however, when enraged, they will
throw defense to the wind and flail about their formidable blades.

Goblins have developed their own complex societies, with some members adopting
specialized roles pertaining to the art of war. Goblin archers will always fire
on their targets from a safe distance. When cornered, they will appear to
surrender, then strike viciously at any unsuspecting foe.

Goblin soldiers are battle-hardened fighters who have developed enough strength
to crush foes with no more than their monstrous fists. They are experienced and
shrewd enough to strategize in the heat of battle but often lack the patience,
choosing instead to wrest victory through brute force.

The goblin warrior is a subclass of goblin, boasting the largest and cruelest of
the brood. Known to quash foes with blunt weapons and shields too heavy for
Human wielders, they fight in brigades, summoning weaker goblins with war cries.
When enraged, these berserkers devastate all within reach, including their own.

These wretched monsters are the remains of soldiers who perished in the line of
duty. A skeleton is devoid of a mind or soul, being nothing more than a puppet
of dark forces compelled to do pointless battle for all eternity.

Though these ice-bound undead warriors appear to be staunchly defending
Leautagne Island from invaders, there is no mind or will to be found in this
collection of frosty bones.

The mighty bones of these fallen warriors are manipulated by dark spirits into
reenacting their final moments in battle again and again. When it senses a
living creature, a gerasene will let rip a cry of pure enmity before bearing
down with its great halberd.

These undead monsters were once warriors who perished atop snowy mountains. They
were revived by frost spirits and became shrouded in magical, icy vapors and
distended to a mammoth size. A scarmiglione lacks self-awareness and will
beleaguer the living until it or its target are driven to ruination.

A monster commonly seen throughout the Sky Realm. More intelligent than the
common beast, they often roam in packs and are intensely loyal to their leader.
Using their razor-sharp fangs, they swiftly kill their prey with ease.

As the name suggests, wolf riders hunt prey astride timber wolves, utilizing the
speed of the canid to strike and withdraw to safety. The relationship between
goblin and wolf is purely one of convenience, and when a mount is injured, its
rider will abandon it without a second thought.

This dive-bombing avian monster is noteworthy for the large horn 
with which it skewers prey.

These small, winged reptiles nest all over the Sky Realm. They resemble
dragons but are not classified as such. Wyverns make for clever hunters,
though they lack the higher faculty of reason. They attack airships on sight,
understanding them to be valuable sources of food.

These massive reptile-like monsters are bipedal. The quakadile is encrusted in
mineral scales that provide a near-impervious defense but also burden it with a
debilitating weight. Because each movement is so energy-consuming, they hunt by
camouflaging themselves as boulders and lying in wait for hapless prey.

These reptile-like monsters are encrusted in scales of impermeable ice and are
believed by researchers to be a subspecies of the quakadile. They hunt by
discharging blasts of frost, which causes prey to slip or freeze to the ground.

This reptile-like monster sports a layer of pyroclastic rock so thick it can
swim freely through magma. It derives energy from volcanic fumes. Though this
species spends most of its time stationary, camouflaged among boulders, once an
infernadile is on the hunt, it will not stop until it or its prey is destroyed.

These peculiar creatures sometimes appear in a jug that's been filled with
water. They're not very dangerous but will multiply if left unattended.

A variant of slime that shines with a silvery luster. By absorbing their
surrounding metallic casing, their bodies mutate into a unique blend of valuable
metals and monster parts.

This dazzling variant of slime glimmers in a gorgeous gold. Some say that they
obtain their luster by pilfering hidden gold from careless nobles. Due to the
vast numbers of skyfarers looking to strike it rich, their numbers continue to
dwindle.

These large, glistening silver slimes are popular game among skyfarers.
The very few who manage to outrun the scythe of extinction are
honored with the title of "King."

It is commonly held that the body of this large golden slime is formed of
material so rich that capturing one would handsomely feed a skydweller for life.
However, so few have seen this variant of the already-rare goldslime that some
people doubt it exists.

These ghastly monsters resemble winged eyeballs and are especially adapted to
snowy environments. They can flit about deftly even in blizzards, vexing prey
with blasts of ice magic from their staring orbs. Some researchers believe
cyaegha may be juvenile Nazarbonju, but as of yet, this theory is unconfirmed.

Nazarbonju are seen as ill omens, reapers of hapless pilgrims atop sacred
mountains. The eye forms ninety percent of their bodies. Years of mana and
frost have built up in these staring orifices, and one glare from an eyeball
can freeze a wildfire, but few witnesses have survived to verify the tale.

The core of this small spirit is formed of pure fire energy. It's said that this
core will continue to burn long after its host is defunct.

The core of this small spirit is formed of pure water energy. Because it sponges
moisture from its environs, these gyres are pestilent to lifeforms composed
largely of water.

This small earth spirit is most often found in arid regions. It is easily
startled and will lash out blindly when it feels threatened.

The core of this small spirit is formed of pure light energy. Though it runs on
an element worthy of divinity, the light gyre is a monster that will strike at
anything it deems a threat. It only goes to show that, in the mortal realm, all
creatures are subject to corruption.

The core of this small spirit is formed of pure dark energy. It is a
particularly perilous gyre, for the dark element, unadulterated and unimpeded,
will suck in light until the whole of existence is cast in perpetual night.

This bright creature is brimming with fire energy, which it draws in from its
environs. Fiercely territorial, the fire spirit will attack all trespassers,
living or dead, burning away at foreign matter until only cinders are left.

The crystal embedded in these ethereal creatures contains potent water magic;
when shattered, its host will also cease to function. Water spirits draw energy
from their environs, thus specimens living near rivers, lakes, and oceans are
far more powerful than their brethren who dwell in arid regions.

Sabers are privates who specialize in swordplay, often seen in the vanguard of
an Aviaeth formation. Versatile in and out of battle, they're given light-weight
mobile armor to help carry out a variety of roles, most commonly that of
scouting and patrolling.

Due to the long reach of their weapons, lancers routinely lead the vanguard in
Aviaeth formations. These troops also bear shields, shifting between offense and
defense as needed. Though the risks are great, so are the rewards, as those who
survive often rack up military exploits and go on to become flagbearers.

Aviaeth archers are privates who, in addition to providing ranged fire, function
as army medics. They bear composite bows, where the traditional wood body of the
bow is reinforced by a metal plate.

Aviaeth flagbearers are officers charged with directing troop formations. They
bear pikes adorned with pennants and will seek to boost allied morale by leading
charges. They also don helmets with distinctive emblems signifying their rank.

Rook is both a devout worshipper and a powerful soldier, tasked with judging
heathens deemed hostile to the church. Despite the grim nature of his role, he
was raised an honest man and will sometimes display mercy toward the indicted—a
quality that has earned him a large following.

Avalan is one of Avia's most fervent believers, enticed not by its philosophy,
but by the cult of personality surrounding Lilith. Cruel and calculating, Avalan
is tasked with persecuting deserters and apostates. The combination of his
strength and savagery has earned him the respect and fear of his colleagues.

This secret society pledges loyalty to Maglielle, one of Avia's three generals.
Reports claim that each member bears preternatural abilities. Like Maglielle,
they can control a number of magic blades as determined by individual mana
levels, flitting in and out of combat with elusive, ghost-like movements.

Part of the Aviaeth mechanized arsenal, droita mothers are outfitted with pseudo
artificial intelligence and are capable of autonomous operation. These moving
forts boast armor impervious to standard-issue swords and act as conveyers to
the smaller droita balsams. They attack by discharging electric shocks.

Part of the Aviaeth mechanized arsenal, droita balsams are equipped with motion
